thread.title: Shay Mitchell’s millennial take on the pantsuit is business meets sexy
thread.title_full: Shay Mitchell’s millennial take on the pantsuit is business meets sexy

author: Claire Beaudreault
title: Shay Mitchell’s millennial take on the pantsuit is business meets sexy
text:
Shay Mitchell’s millennial take on the pantsuit is business meets sexy Actress Shay Mitchell wore a pantsuit to a star-studded event and proved that the look isn’t just for the office (or the campaign trail!).
The women in suits look isn’t new by any means but young stars are really having a moment with it . Millennials have taken the power suit look and turned it sexy. The Pretty Little Liars star rocked some sleek black Elizabeth and James spring suiting to Vanity Fair and L’Oréal Paris’ Toast to Young Hollywood, and the effect was stunning!
Celebrity makeup artist Patrick Ta did a heavy black winged liner on the Shades of Shay star’s almond-shaped eyes and kept the rest of her face matte and neutral. Shay’s usual strong brow framed the eye perfectly, and a nude lip let the eyes take the spotlight.
This eyeliner means business. Yes Eyeliner @shaym Hair @laurapolko Makeup @patrickta Style @bartolistyle 
A post shared by Patrick Ta (@patrickta) on Feb 21, 2017 at 10:20pm PST 
Celebrity hairstylist Laura Polko used Aussie products to make Shay’s long dark locks as shiny and smooth as her suit.
Emma McIntyre / Stringer / Getty Stylists Chloe and Marie-Lou Bartoli tied the look together with pointy Olgana heels , and gorgeous green hued gems from Coomi Jewelry . (Shay traded in her BFF necklace for the night.) The emerald drop earrings and ring remind us of a jewelry look loved by Angelina Jolie.
Charley Gallay / Getty Images The all-black ensemble is a total vintage Jolie vibe, too! Steve Granitz / Getty Images Patrick got creative with the effects on this one. It’s a threeShay! (Sorry.) Tonight's Vanity Fair Young Hollywood @shaym Hair @laurapolko Makeup @patrickta Styling @bartolistyle 
A post shared by Patrick Ta (@patrickta) on Feb 21, 2017 at 11:45pm PST 
It’s not really possible to write about Shay’s red carpet outfits without saying that “Shay slays,” because she ALWAYS does. Can’t wait to see what she steps out in next!
